tweet: .@NitaLowey: @RepKayGranger is a dear friend & an invaluable colleague. The 116th Congress will be a historic moment for women in leadership in the House & the Appropriations Committee, and I look forward to working with Kay to invest in America’s future.  https://bit.ly/2RvGtHu

“In the 116th Congress, @AppropsDems will prioritize investing in our country. We must raise the unworkable budget caps and restore funding for the safety net & infrastructure. We must reclaim Congress’ Constitutional power of the purse and conduct rigorous oversight of @POTUS.”

Ranking Member @NitaLowey: "Americans have spoken and they have empowered @HouseDemocrats to fight #ForThePeople. It is now up to us to get to work and take action that raises wages, lowers health care costs & cleans up corruption."

On November 5th, 1968, #ShirleyChisholm made history as the first African American woman elected to Congress. 

It’s been 50 years since that milestone — but we have work left to do. Your #vote is your voice. Use it. pic.twitter.com/tsCsEnZni9

JUST IN: By a vote of 300-128, the House adopted the conference report, sending legislation to fund the entire government through Sept. 30th & fund key national priorities to the President’s desk. Read @AppropsDems Chairwoman @NitaLowey’s full statement →  https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/house-passes-legislation-to-keep-government-open-fund-key-priorities … pic.twitter.com/IDPMdAmeSA

Neither Democrats nor Republicans got everything they wanted, yet every Democrat and nearly every Republican who served on the conference committee to write this bill has signed it in support.

@NitaLowey: “I urge a yes vote.”
The $1.375 billion it provides for border barriers is 76% less than the President demanded for a concrete wall, and critical protections are put in place for environmentally sensitive areas.

The Homeland Security division of this bill upholds Democratic values and funds smart and effective border security including construction and screening technology at ports of entry, where most drugs illegally enter the country. pic.twitter.com/m5JfyogKE2
Federal workers will receive a 1.9% pay raise that the President attempted to deny hardworking families. pic.twitter.com/ssS63HLtQd
Strong international affairs funding will help stabilize the world economy, meet unprecedented humanitarian needs, and continue our fight against radical extremism and terrorism.

Among the bill’s vital increases are:
 
✅ $80 million for state and local law enforcement to keep communities safe;
✅ $1 billion for the Census Bureau
✅ $308 million for research and development at the NSF
✅ $25 million for the @EPA
✅ $293 million for port infrastructure
Additionally, it does not contain poison pill riders that threatened the environment, public health, and consumer protections in the House Republican versions of these bills.
This bipartisan compromise rejects the President’s irresponsible budget cuts & instead invests in priorities that will strengthen our families, communities, and economy.

THREAD: @AppropsDems Chairwoman @NitaLowey on the conference agreement under consideration: 

The bill before us represents what is possible in a strong democratic process, when we work hard to reach agreement that puts politics aside & puts the American people first.

HAPPENING NOW: The House is debating the bipartisan, House & Senate conference legislation to keep the government open & fund smart, effective border security measures without compromising our values OR funding President Trump’s border wall. Watch →  http://live.house.gov

Today’s conference agreement funds smart & effective border security measures, & provides funding to ensure a more humane immigration system. 

The legislation funds key priorities, including $ for hiring more immigration judges & funding construction projects at ports of entry. pic.twitter.com/EDy81BbMVv

By rejecting the President’s proposed cuts to critical global initiatives & ensuring crucial support for our allies, today’s conference report strengthens American global leadership and funds programs that reflect American values. pic.twitter.com/mnNQdU1PDw

Protecting our natural & cultural heritage is a key priority of the conference agreement reached by House & Senate negotiations – including investments like $8.8 billion for the @EPA and rejecting proposed eliminations of the National Endowment for the Arts & for the Humanities. pic.twitter.com/gm3oXgGxeG

ALSO in today’s bipartisan conference agreement: $3.8 billion for the Census Bureau – an increase of $1 billion – to ensure a fair & accurate count in the 2020 Census #Census2020 pic.twitter.com/jyIX3MKSw5

Restoring & increasing investments in job-creating initiatives for economic & business development are key provisions in the conference report. The bill has specific investments for minority and women-owned businesses, programs that the Trump Administration had tried to slash. pic.twitter.com/FdVkGyo2FR

Investments to restore & rebuild America’s infrastructure are central to today’s conference agreement under consideration. It includes $17 billion for new infrastructure investments to improve our roads, bridges, highways, railways and mass transit. pic.twitter.com/jEOu82sBCg

The bipartisan, bicameral conference agreement includes NO FUNDING for Trump’s border wall, provides a glide path to reduce ICE detention beds, & funds $415m for humanitarian assistance to migrants–prioritizing a more humane immigration system & smart, effective border security. pic.twitter.com/T828ekrLDB

.@AppropsDems support smart investments in ports of entry, humanitarian assistance, technology improvements, & personnel to comprehensively strengthen border security. 

Because border security is more than physical security, & homeland security is more than border security.

Homeland Security Chairwoman & @AppropsDems conference committee member @RepRoybalAllard: There's been a lot of inaccurate rhetoric about a security crisis at the border that supposedly can only be solved by a multi-billion dollar border wall.

I hope that all stakeholders, including @POTUS, will work in good faith to support us as we carry out our responsibilities.

Together, we can secure our border and uphold our values.

Read @NitaLowey's full statement: https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/chairwoman-lowey-statement-at-house-senate-conference-committee-on-homeland …

I know that the American people are counting on us to come to a reasonable and responsible solution.

Consistent with the proud tradition of our committees, I am confident that we will be able to reach a compromise.

It is also important to recognize that the @DHSgov bill includes other key pieces of our nation’s security platform, including the @USCG, @TSA, and @FEMA.

Every dollar spent on ineffective proposals means one less dollar invested in measures that actually keep us safe.
Smart border security is not overly reliant on physical barriers, which the Trump administration has failed to demonstrate are cost effective compared to better technology and more personnel.
My Democratic colleagues and I are ready to work in good faith to write a Department of Homeland Security bill that funds smart, effective border security.
In the next 16 days, our task is clear: finalizing appropriations legislation that responsibly funds much of the federal government – everything from our National Parks to border security.
We can all agree that we must do everything we can to prevent another unnecessary and destructive government shutdown.

.@HouseDemocrats support investing in border security, but we oppose wasting taxpayer dollars on an unnecessary border wall that @realDonaldTrump promised Mexico would pay for.

Republicans should negotiate in good faith so we can end the #TrumpShutdown. https://twitter.com/cbsnews/status/1079474021987700738?s=21 …

More than 800,000 public servants — including 41,000 law enforcement officers — aren't getting paid because @realDonaldTrump shut down the government.

@HouseDemocrats are ready to end the #TrumpShutdown and get our federal government working again. https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1078260814157701121 …

From food safety inspections to home mortgage applications, the federal government’s work for the American people is being held up by @realDonaldTrump & @HouseGOP. Learn more → https://www.democraticleader.gov/newsroom/122118/ …

There’s nothing “fake” about the #TrumpShutdown. More than 800,000 federal workers are not getting paid days before Christmas & critical services for the American people have been halted. https://twitter.com/realdonaldtrump/status/1076512233897771010?s=21 …

With a shutdown looming, @HouseGOP just passed a bill that wastes $5 billion on a border wall, underfunds disaster relief & is dead on arrival in the Senate.

It’s time for Republicans to stop the political games, get to work, and keep our government open. https://twitter.com/craigcaplan/status/1075918498554101760?s=21 …
.@NitaLowey: Democrats support smart, strong border security, but we won’t let Republicans fleece the American people by wasting $5 billion on an unnecessary border wall.
.@RepMikeQuigley: If you really want to protect our country, we would be spending money to #ProtectOurDemocracy from Russian attacks, not wasting it on an ineffective, unnecessary wall.

.@RepDWStweets: Our country faces many pressing needs, and it is simply ridiculous to waste $5.7 billion on President Trump’s immorral, unnecessary border wall - which Mexico was supposed to pay for in the first place.

.@RepTimRyan: Everywhere he went on the campaign trail, President Trump promised that Mexico would pay for the border wall. But now he wants to shut down the government to make American taxpayers foot the bill.
.@BettyMcCollum04: Our nation faces many pressing needs, like addressing the opioid epidemic and climate change, but instead this bill wastes $5 billion on an unnecessary border wall.
.@SanfordBishop: This legislation includes only a token response for rural communities & farmers devastated by natural disasters. It is totally inadequate to meet the needs of the American people.
.@rosadelauro: The American people do not want a government shutdown. It’s up to Republicans to choose between performing the basic job of government or performing for Fox News.

.@WhipHoyer: It is embarrassing that we have gotten to a point where we are nearing a government shutdown just before the holidays. The only purpose of this ridiculous bill is to pander to @realDonaldTrump.
.@RepBarbaraLee: Shutting down the government over President Trump’s wasteful border wall is unnecessary and ridiculous. There is simply no reason to waste money on this mean-spirited concept.
.@RepRoybalAllard: If we spend $5 billion on a wasteful border wall, we will not have the resources for urgent security priorities that keep American families & communities safe.
.@RepRoybalAllard: At a time of great economic uncertainty and just before the holidays, Republicans are refusing to stand up to President Trump and keep the federal government open.

.@RepDavidEPrice: Adding disaster relief to this bill is a cynical political stunt. It is cruel to hold the lives of people who have been affected by natural disasters in the balance as part of a debate over an unnecessary border wall.

.@RepJoseSerrano: This country, of all countries, should not be building a wall. There is no support for building a wall, so the only way that Republicans can get this wall built is by jamming it on a must-pass funding bill.
.@RepMarcyKaptur: President Trump’s refusal to make a responsible deal to keep the government open is like a child who overturns the Monopoly board when they are losing the game.
.@NitaLowey: This bill is nothing but another attempt by lame duck Republicans to appease President Trump. It is a fitting final act for the most chaotic & dysfunctional Congress in modern history.

.@NitaLowey: With all the challenges we face, it is inconceivable that @HouseGOP wants to spend more than $5 billion on an unnecessary wall that @realDonaldTrump himself promised Mexico would pay for.

.@NitaLowey: Instead of showing leadership and standing up to Trump, @HouseGOP have caved once again to his political whims. This bill wastes tax dollars, fails to meet the urgent needs of disaster victims & cannot pass in the Senate.
.@NitaLowey: Even a simple stopgap measure is apparently unacceptable to a President hellbent on shutting down the government over his wasteful wall.

NOW: On the brink of a shutdown, the House is considering a @HouseGOP bill that wastes $5 billion on Trump’s border wall, inadequately funds disaster relief & is dead on arrival in the Senate.

Congress should reject this bill and pass a clean CR to keep the government open.

.@NitaLowey: Our talented incoming subcommittee chairs and the rest of our new Democratic Majority will work together to write responsible legislation that reflects the American people’s priorities and fully funds the government for the rest of the fiscal year. #ForThePeople
.@NitaLowey: When @HouseDemocrats assume control in two weeks, my primary focus will be to pass reasonable spending legislation that does not fund President Trump’s wasteful wall.

.@NitaLowey: It is deeply disappointing that Trump & the lame duck Republican Congress couldn’t even complete their final task of funding the government and have instead chosen to kick the can down the road for a third time. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1075435613271285760 …

.@NitaLowey: I am also particularly mindful of the history I am making as the first female Appropriations Chair, and I intend to use this opportunity to continue my life’s work fighting for women and families.

.@NitaLowey: I look forward to working with our talented subcommittee leaders & committee members, our entire Caucus, and our counterparts across the aisle & across the Capitol to lift unworkable budget caps and pass reasonable spending bills that responsibly fund our government.

.@NitaLowey: Americans have entrusted @HouseDemocrats with the responsibility of making government work for them. The Appropriations Committee will lead the way to invest in working families, repair our infrastructure & provide robust oversight of the Trump administration.
